comments: If 1 is excluded (of form [e^0]) then complement of A000149. - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 16 2013
references: J. Lambek and L. Moser, Inverse and complementary sequences of natural numbers, Amer. Math. Monthly, 61 (1954), 454-458.
J. Roberts, Lure of the Integers, Math. Assoc. America, 1992, p. 11.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
prog: (PARI) a(n) = n + floor( log (n + 1 + floor( log (n + 1) )) ) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 16 2013(Haskell)a003619 n = n + floor (log (x + fromIntegral (floor $ log x)))            where x = fromIntegral n + 1-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 17 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Mira Bernstein_
